name: Institute of Professional Qualifications
goal:
The Institute of Professional Qualifications acts as an independent professional platform to support
and develop dialogue between employers and employees on vocational education and training issues, to strengthen cooperation between all stakeholders in the development of professional standards and
qualifications.
Our main goals:
‐ to develop an independent professional platform for conducting a dialogue in the field of professional
qualifications
‐ setting up and following‐up cooperation between labour market, educational services providers,
representatives of employers and employees
‐ conducting research and presenting recommendations for stakeholders in priority fields of activity
‐ organization of public educational activities on issues related to the system of professional
qualifications.
Main lines of our activities:
‐ contribution to the formation and development of the system of professional qualifications and its
components (occupational standards, sector skills councils, assessment centres)
‐ assistance in the development of occupational standards and qualifications
‐ contribution to quality assurance in education
‐ analysis of the formation of the state order for training specialists, contribution to labour market
intelligence
‐ contribution to the development of the national system of guidance, creation of various learning
paths in lifelong perspective.
interests: Education and training, Employment and Social Affairs, Youth
euInitiatives:
Development and implementation of European Qualification Framework (Recommendation of the European Parliament and of the Council of 23 April 2008 on the establishment of the European Qualifications Framework for lifelong learning, (2008/C 111/01)

Support of realization of Bologna process at the national level (Framework for Qualifications of the European Higher Education Area (Bologna Working Group on Qualifications Frameworks, Bergen, May 2005)

Introducing key competences for life-long learning at the national educational standards (Recommendation of the European Parliament and of the Council of 18 December, 2006, on key competences for lifelong learning (2006/962/EC)

Validation of non-formal and informal learning (European Guidelines for Validation of non-formal and informal learning, CEDEFOP, Luxembourg: Office for Official Publications of the European Communities, 2009 )
